00003 /***************************************************************************/
00004 /* RSC IDENTIFIER: MILLER
00005  *
00006  * ABSTRACT
00007  *
00008  *    This component provides conversions between Geodetic coordinates
00009  *    (latitude and longitude in radians) and Miller Cylindrical projection 
00010  *    coordinates (easting and northing in meters).  The Miller Cylindrical
00011  *    projection employs a spherical Earth model.  The Spherical Radius
00012  *    used is the the radius of the sphere having the same area as the
00013  *    ellipsoid.
00014  *
00015  * ERROR HANDLING
00016  *
00017  *    This component checks parameters for valid values.  If an invalid value
00018  *    is found, the error code is combined with the current error code using 
00019  *    the bitwise or.  This combining allows multiple error codes to be
00020  *    returned. The possible error codes are:
00021  *
00022  *          MILL_NO_ERROR           : No errors occurred in function
00023  *          MILL_LAT_ERROR          : Latitude outside of valid range
00024  *                                      (-90 to 90 degrees)
00025  *          MILL_LON_ERROR          : Longitude outside of valid range
00026  *                                      (-180 to 360 degrees)
00027  *          MILL_EASTING_ERROR      : Easting outside of valid range
00028  *                                      (False_Easting +/- ~20,000,000 m,
00029  *                                       depending on ellipsoid parameters)
00030  *          MILL_NORTHING_ERROR     : Northing outside of valid range
00031  *                                      (False_Northing +/- ~14,000,000 m,
00032  *                                       depending on ellipsoid parameters)
00033  *          MILL_CENT_MER_ERROR     : Central meridian outside of valid range
00034  *                                      (-180 to 360 degrees)
00035  *          MILL_A_ERROR            : Semi-major axis less than or equal to zero
00036  *          MILL_INV_F_ERROR        : Inverse flattening outside of valid range
00037  *                                                                                          (250 to 350)
00038  *
00039  * REUSE NOTES
00040  *
00041  *    MILLER is intended for reuse by any application that performs a
00042  *    Miller Cylindrical projection or its inverse.
00043  *
00044  * REFERENCES
00045  *
00046  *    Further information on MILLER can be found in the Reuse Manual.
00047  *
00048  *    MILLER originated from :  U.S. Army Topographic Engineering Center
00049  *                                Geospatial Information Division
00050  *                                7701 Telegraph Road
00051  *                                Alexandria, VA  22310-3864
00052  *
00053  * LICENSES
00054  *
00055  *    None apply to this component.
00056  *
00057  * RESTRICTIONS
00058  *
00059  *    MILLER has no restrictions.
00060  *
00061  * ENVIRONMENT
00062  *
00063  *    MILLER was tested and certified in the following environments:
00064  *
00065  *    1. Solaris 2.5 with GCC 2.8.1
00066  *    2. Windows 95 with MS Visual C++ 6
00067  *
00068  * MODIFICATIONS
00069  *
00070  *    Date              Description
00071  *    ----              -----------
00072  *    04-16-99          Original Code
00073  *    03-05-07          Original C++ Code
00074  *
00075  */
00076 
00077

00095  *    GeodeticCoordinates.h   - defines geodetic coordinates
00096  *    CoordinateConversionException.h - Exception handler
00097  *    ErrorMessages.h  - Contains exception messages
00098  */
00099

00109 const double PI = 3.14159265358979323e0;     /* PI     */
00110 const double PI_OVER_2 = ( PI / 2.0);                
00111 const double TWO_PI = (2.0 * PI);

00118 
00119 MillerCylindrical::MillerCylindrical( double ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis, double ellipsoidFlattening, double centralMeridian, double falseEasting, double falseNorthing ) :
00120   CoordinateSystem(),
00121    es2( 0.0066943799901413800 ),
00122    es4( 4.4814723452405e-005 ),
00123    es6( 3.0000678794350e-007 ),
00124    Ra( 6371007.1810824 ),
00125    Mill_Origin_Long( 0.0 ),
00126    Mill_False_Easting( 0.0 ),
00127    Mill_False_Northing( 0.0 ),
00128    Mill_Delta_Northing( 14675058.0 ),
00129    Mill_Max_Easting( 20015110.0 ),
00130    Mill_Min_Easting( -20015110.0 )
00131 {
00132 /*
00133  * The constructor receives the ellipsoid parameters and
00134  * Miller Cylindrical projcetion parameters as inputs, and sets the corresponding
00135  * state variables.  If any errors occur, an exception is thrown with a description 
00136  * of the error.
00137  *
00138  *    ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis  : Semi-major axis of ellipsoid, in meters   (input)
00139  *    ellipsoidFlattening     : Flattening of ellipsoid                                                 (input)
00140  *    centralMeridian         : Longitude in radians at the center of     (input)
00141  *                              the projection
00142  *    falseEasting            : A coordinate value in meters assigned to the
00143  *                              central meridian of the projection.       (input)
00144  *    falseNorthing           : A coordinate value in meters assigned to the
00145  *                              origin latitude of the projection         (input)
00146  */
00147 
00148   double inv_f = 1 / ellipsoidFlattening;
00149   char errorStatus[500] = "";
00150 
00151   if (ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis <= 0.0)
00152   { /* Semi-major axis must be greater than zero */
00153     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::semiMajorAxis );
00154   }
00155   if ((inv_f < 250) || (inv_f > 350))
00156   { /* Inverse flattening must be between 250 and 350 */
00157     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::ellipsoidFlattening );
00158   }
00159   if ((centralMeridian < -PI) || (centralMeridian > TWO_PI))
00160   { /* origin longitude out of range */
00161     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::centralMeridian );
00162   }
00163 
00164   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00165     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00166 
00167   semiMajorAxis = ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis;
00168   flattening = ellipsoidFlattening;
00169 
00170   es2 = 2 * flattening - flattening * flattening;
00171   es4 = es2 * es2;
00172   es6 = es4 * es2;
00173   /* spherical radius */
00174   Ra = semiMajorAxis * (1.0 - es2 / 6.0 - 17.0 * es4 / 360.0 - 67.0 * es6 /3024.0);
00175   if (centralMeridian > PI)
00176     centralMeridian -= TWO_PI;
00177   Mill_Origin_Long = centralMeridian;
00178   Mill_False_Easting = falseEasting;
00179   Mill_False_Northing = falseNorthing;
00180   if (Mill_Origin_Long > 0)
00181   {
00182     Mill_Max_Easting = 19903915.0;
00183     Mill_Min_Easting = -20015110.0;
00184   }
00185   else if (Mill_Origin_Long < 0)
00186   {
00187     Mill_Max_Easting = 20015110.0;
00188     Mill_Min_Easting = -19903915.0;
00189   }
00190   else
00191   {
00192     Mill_Max_Easting = 20015110.0;
00193     Mill_Min_Easting = -20015110.0;
00194   }
00195 }

00198 MillerCylindrical::MillerCylindrical( const MillerCylindrical &mc )
00199 {
00200   semiMajorAxis = mc.semiMajorAxis;
00201   flattening = mc.flattening;
00202   es2 = mc.es2;
00203   es4 = mc.es4;
00204   es6 = mc.es6;
00205   Ra = mc.Ra;
00206   Mill_Origin_Long = mc.Mill_Origin_Long;
00207   Mill_False_Easting = mc.Mill_False_Easting;
00208   Mill_False_Northing = mc.Mill_False_Northing;
00209   Mill_Delta_Northing = mc.Mill_Delta_Northing;
00210   Mill_Max_Easting = mc.Mill_Max_Easting;
00211   Mill_Min_Easting = mc.Mill_Min_Easting;
00212 }

00220 MillerCylindrical& MillerCylindrical::operator=( const MillerCylindrical &mc )
00221 {
00222   if( this != &mc )
00223   {
00224     semiMajorAxis = mc.semiMajorAxis;
00225     flattening = mc.flattening;
00226     es2 = mc.es2;
00227     es4 = mc.es4;
00228     es6 = mc.es6;
00229     Ra = mc.Ra;
00230     Mill_Origin_Long = mc.Mill_Origin_Long;
00231     Mill_False_Easting = mc.Mill_False_Easting;
00232     Mill_False_Northing = mc.Mill_False_Northing;
00233     Mill_Delta_Northing = mc.Mill_Delta_Northing;
00234     Mill_Max_Easting = mc.Mill_Max_Easting;
00235     Mill_Min_Easting = mc.Mill_Min_Easting;
00236   }
00237 
00238   return *this;
00239 }

00242 MapProjection3Parameters* MillerCylindrical::getParameters() const
00243 {
00244 /*
00245  * The function getParameters returns the current ellipsoid
00246  * parameters and Miller Cylindrical projection parameters.
00247  *
00248  *    ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis  : Semi-major axis of ellipsoid, in meters   (output)
00249  *    ellipsoidFlattening     : Flattening of ellipsoid                                                 (output)
00250  *    centralMeridian         : Longitude in radians at the center of     (output)
00251  *                              the projection
00252  *    falseEasting            : A coordinate value in meters assigned to the
00253  *                              central meridian of the projection.       (output)
00254  *    falseNorthing           : A coordinate value in meters assigned to the
00255  *                              origin latitude of the projection         (output)
00256  */
00257 
00258   return new MapProjection3Parameters( CoordinateType::millerCylindrical, Mill_Origin_Long, Mill_False_Easting, Mill_False_Northing );
00259 }
00260 
00261 
00262 MSP::CCS::MapProjectionCoordinates* MillerCylindrical::convertFromGeodetic( MSP::CCS::GeodeticCoordinates* geodeticCoordinates )
00263 {
00264 /*
00265  * The function convertFromGeodetic converts geodetic (latitude and
00266  * longitude) coordinates to Miller Cylindrical projection (easting and northing)
00267  * coordinates, according to the current ellipsoid and Miller Cylindrical projection
00268  * parameters.  If any errors occur, an exception is thrown with a description 
00269  * of the error.
00270  *
00271  *    longitude         : Longitude (lambda) in radians       (input)
00272  *    latitude          : Latitude (phi) in radians           (input)
00273  *    easting           : Easting (X) in meters               (output)
00274  *    northing          : Northing (Y) in meters              (output)
00275  */
00276 
00277   double dlam;     /* Longitude - Central Meridan */
00278   char errorStatus[50] = "";
00279 
00280   double longitude = geodeticCoordinates->longitude();
00281   double latitude = geodeticCoordinates->latitude();
00282   double slat = sin(0.8 * latitude);
00283 
00284   if ((latitude < -PI_OVER_2) || (latitude > PI_OVER_2))
00285   {  /* Latitude out of range */
00286     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::latitude );
00287   }
00288   if ((longitude < -PI) || (longitude > TWO_PI))
00289   {  /* Longitude out of range */
00290     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::longitude );
00291   }
00292 
00293   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00294     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00295 
00296   dlam = longitude - Mill_Origin_Long;
00297   if (dlam > PI)
00298   {
00299     dlam -= TWO_PI;
00300   }
00301   if (dlam < -PI)
00302   {
00303     dlam += TWO_PI;
00304   }
00305   double easting = Ra * dlam + Mill_False_Easting;
00306   double northing = (Ra / 1.6) * log((1.0 + slat) /
00307                                (1.0 - slat)) + Mill_False_Northing;
00308 
00309   return new MapProjectionCoordinates( CoordinateType::millerCylindrical, easting, northing );
00310 }
00311 
00312 
00313 MSP::CCS::GeodeticCoordinates* MillerCylindrical::convertToGeodetic( MSP::CCS::MapProjectionCoordinates* mapProjectionCoordinates )
00314 {
00315 /*
00316  * The function convertToGeodetic converts Miller Cylindrical projection
00317  * (easting and northing) coordinates to geodetic (latitude and longitude)
00318  * coordinates, according to the current ellipsoid and Miller Cylindrical projection
00319  * coordinates.  If any errors occur, an exception is thrown with a description 
00320  * of the error.
00321  *
00322  *    easting           : Easting (X) in meters                  (input)
00323  *    northing          : Northing (Y) in meters                 (input)
00324  *    longitude         : Longitude (lambda) in radians          (output)
00325  *    latitude          : Latitude (phi) in radians              (output)
00326  */
00327 
00328   double dx, dy;
00329   char errorStatus[50] = "";
00330 
00331   double easting = mapProjectionCoordinates->easting();
00332   double northing = mapProjectionCoordinates->northing();
00333 
00334   if ((easting < (Mill_False_Easting + Mill_Min_Easting))
00335       || (easting > (Mill_False_Easting + Mill_Max_Easting)))
00336   { /* Easting out of range  */
00337     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::easting );
00338   }
00339   if ((northing < (Mill_False_Northing - Mill_Delta_Northing)) || 
00340       (northing > (Mill_False_Northing + Mill_Delta_Northing) ))
00341   { /* Northing out of range */
00342     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::northing );
00343   }
00344 
00345   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00346     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00347 
00348   dy = northing - Mill_False_Northing;
00349   dx = easting - Mill_False_Easting;
00350   double latitude = atan(sinh(0.8 * dy / Ra)) / 0.8;
00351   double longitude = Mill_Origin_Long + dx / Ra;
00352 
00353   if (latitude > PI_OVER_2)  /* force distorted values to 90, -90 degrees */
00354     latitude = PI_OVER_2;
00355   else if (latitude < -PI_OVER_2)
00356     latitude = -PI_OVER_2;
00357 
00358   if (longitude > PI)
00359     longitude -= TWO_PI;
00360   if (longitude < -PI)
00361     longitude += TWO_PI;
00362 
00363   if (longitude > PI)  /* force distorted values to 180, -180 degrees */
00364     longitude = PI;
00365   else if (longitude < -PI)
00366     longitude = -PI;
00367 
00368   return new GeodeticCoordinates( CoordinateType::geodetic, longitude, latitude );
00369 }
